channel.title: Aaditya's Space
channel.description: This website is a virtual proof that I'm awesome

item.title: Terminator Vision
item.description: Seeing everything as terminator does - INTRODUCTION The terminator is a robot from a movie that time travels into the past to save someone. I love watching robot movies and got goosebumbs after watching terminator. I decided to make a device that can let me see things like terminator does. Basic idea The ideas was to...

item.title: Hand gestures
item.description: Using hand gestures to control my laptop - Introduction I was going through my laptop settings one day and found and option for eyetracking, sadly it was disabled as my hardware wasn’t compattible. So I decided to make my own. Instead of eye tracking I felt that hand gestures would be much cooler and make me feel like...

item.title: Quotelet
item.description: An automated A.I. channel - An automated A.I. channel For the past year we’ve seen a lot of A.I. generated content on youtube. Now there is a difference between A.I. generated and automation we must understand first, A.I. (artificial intelligence) generated content is the content A.I. thinks of, for example a script for a video,...

item.title: ESP32 macropad
item.description: My own customisable bluetooth deck - ESP32 MACROPAD A macropad is a physical device with buttons that are mapped to some customizable functions. It is used to enhance productivity, for navigating software, playing games or all of these at once. I have made my own version of it using the blekeyboard library and the esp32. Components...

item.title: ESP Chat server
item.description: A chat server I host using the esp32 - Introduction My goal was to create a live-chat server that doesn’t require access to the internet. Phones and computers can connect to the server directly without having internet access, I wanted to create a chat server to help people from my neighbourhood be in contact with each other during power-cuts...

item.title: Optimized prime miner
item.description: My Take on Optimization - Optimized prime miner I used the Square Root Theorem for Primality Testing as the base program. It works by taking the new number’s square root and checking if prime numbers less than the root can divide it. If they cannot, it is prime. The program’s goal is to compute as...

item.title: Tug of war game
item.description: A button dexterity game - Tug of war game with esp32 The tug of war game is a button dexterity game. A 2 player game with induidual controllers, that you can spectate through a web interface. Overview of the game The goal of the game is simple: Player 1 and Player 2 each press their...
